intro: Daucus exarmatus, commonly known as the slender carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels. Its root system is relatively small and less developed compared to other carrots, making it less commercially valuable. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, arid environments.
